com.edugility.throwables
Class ThrowableChain

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Throwable
      java.lang.Exception
          com.edugility.throwables.ThrowableChain
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Iterable<Throwable>, Collection<Throwable>
public class ThrowableChain
extends Exception
implements Collection<Throwable>

An Exception (and an implementation of the Collection interface) that also holds a modifiable list of other affiliated Throwables that are not connected to the direct causal chain, but are related in some way nonetheless. Instances of this class are particularly useful when dealing with Throwables in finally blocks.

A ThrowableChain always contains itself, so the return value of its size() method is always at least 1.

Author:
Laird Nelson
See Also:
ThrowableList, Serialized Form

Method Detail

add

public final boolean add(Throwable throwable)
Adds the supplied Throwable to this ThrowableChain if it is non-null and not this ThrowableChain (a ThrowableChain cannot add itself to itself, because it already contains itself), or initializes this ThrowableChain's cause with the supplied Throwable if the cause has not yet been initialized.

If this ThrowableChain's cause is null, then this ThrowableChain's cause is initialized to the supplied Throwable. Otherwise, the supplied Throwable is added to this ThrowableChain's list of affiliated Throwables. The rationale for this behavior is that if a ThrowableChain is being brought into existence at all, it is going to be caused by something, and the first Throwable that is affiliated with this ThrowableChain is therefore deemed to be its cause as well. Please note that the reverse behavior is not true—that is, the Throwable.initCause(Throwable) method, when invoked on this ThrowableChain directly or via the relevant constructor, does not cause the instigating Throwable to be added to this ThrowableChain's list of affiliated Throwables.

Under no circumstances are the supplied Throwable's cause or any transitive causes added to this ThrowableChain's list of affiliated Throwables.

If the supplied Throwable is already contained in this ThrowableChain's list of affiliated Throwables, then no action is taken.

Specified by:
add in interface Collection<Throwable>
Parameters:
throwable - the Throwable to add; may be null in which case no action will be taken
Returns:
true if the supplied Throwable was actually added; false in all other cases

addAll

public final boolean addAll(Collection<? extends Throwable> c)
Adds every non-null element contained by the supplied Collection of Throwables to this ThrowableChain.

Specified by:
addAll in interface Collection<Throwable>
Parameters:
c - the Collection of Throwables; may be null in which case no action is taken
Returns:
true if at least one element was actually added
See Also:

remove

public final boolean remove(Object throwable)
Removes the first instance of the supplied Throwable from this ThrowableChain's list of affiliated Throwables, provided that it is not null or this ThrowableChain itself.

Specified by:
remove in interface Collection<Throwable>
Parameters:
throwable - the affiliated Throwable to remove provided it meets the conditions described
Returns:
true if this ThrowableChain actually removed the supplied Throwable; false otherwise
Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException - if throwable is this ThrowableChain

retainAll

public final boolean retainAll(Collection<?> c)
Causes this ThrowableChain to keep all of the elements found in the supplied Collection and to discard the rest.

Specified by:
retainAll in interface Collection<Throwable>
Parameters:
c - the Collection containing the elements to retain; must not be null or empty; must contain this ThrowableChain (because it is impossible for a ThrowableChain to discard itself)
Returns:
true if the contents of this ThrowableChain were actually affected by this method invocation
Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException - if c is null or empty, or if it does not contain this ThrowableChain (a ThrowableChain must always contain itself as an element)
See Also:
size()

toArray

public final <T> T[] toArray(T[] a)
Attempts to fill and return the supplied array with the contents of this ThrowableChain. If the contents of this ThrowableChain will not fit into the supplied array, a new array will be allocated.

This method never returns null.

Specified by:
toArray in interface Collection<Throwable>
Parameters:
a - the array to fill and return if possible; must not be null
Returns:
the contents of this ThrowableChain as an array; never null
Throws:
NullPointerException - if a is null
See Also:
Collection.toArray(Object[])

asList

public final List<Throwable> asList()
Returns a new unmodifiable view of this ThrowableChain. The returned List is non-null, is non-empty, safe for iteration by multiple threads without synchronization or locking, contains this ThrowableChain itself as the first element, and is behaviorally identical to the List instances returned by the Collections.unmodifiableList(List) method.

Please note that this method does not return a List view of the causal chain of this ThrowableChain.

Returns:
a read-only List view of this ThrowableChain and the underlying list of affiliated Throwables; never null

getAffiliatedThrowables

public final List<Throwable> getAffiliatedThrowables()
Returns a new List of this ThrowableChain's affiliate Throwables. The returned List is guaranteed to be non-null, to be safe for iteration by multiple threads without synchronization or locking, to be behaviorally identical to the List instances returned by the Collections.unmodifiableList(List) and to not contain this ThrowableChain.

This method never returns null.

Returns:
an immutable List of this ThrowableChain's affiliates; never null

size

public int size()
Returns the size of this ThrowableChain. A ThrowableChain always has a size of at least 1.

Specified by:
size in interface Collection<Throwable>
Returns:
the size of this ThrowableChain—a positive integer greater than or equal to 1

iterator

public final Iterator<Throwable> iterator()
Returns an Iterator that can be used to iterate over all affiliated Throwables.

This method never returns null.

The Iterator returned does not iterate over any given Throwable's causal chain.

Specified by:
iterator in interface Iterable<Throwable>
Specified by:
iterator in interface Collection<Throwable>
Returns:
an Iterator; never null; the first element of the Iterator will always be this ThrowableChain
See Also:
asList()

printStackTrace

public void printStackTrace(PrintStream s)

Prints the stack trace of this ThrowableChain and then of every Throwable affiliated with it. Each stack trace is preceded by the following text (quoted here; the quotation marks are not part of the text): "d. " d in the preceding text fragment is substituted with the ordinal position, starting with 1, of the Throwable in question.

Overrides:
printStackTrace in class Throwable
Parameters:
s - the PrintStream to print to; must not be null

printStackTrace

public void printStackTrace(PrintWriter w)

Prints the stack trace of this ThrowableChain and then of every Throwable contained by it. Each stack trace is preceded by the following text (quoted here; the quotation marks are not part of the text): "d. " d in the preceding text fragment is substituted with the ordinal position, starting with 1, of the Throwable in question.

Overrides:
printStackTrace in class Throwable
Parameters:
w - the PrintWriter to print to; must not be null
